meanings.definition: To equip or supply with military forces
meanings.sent1: The general militarizes the troops before sending them to the battlefield.
meanings.sent2: The government militarizes the army with new weapons and gear.
meanings.sent3: The birthday party was militarized with toy soldiers and tanks for decorations.
meanings.sent4: Her strict training regimen militarizes her approach to fitness.
meanings.sent5: The storm clouds militarize the once peaceful sky, hinting at a coming battle.

meanings.sent1: The commander militarizes the operation, ensuring every detail is planned.
meanings.sent2: During wartime, countries often militarize their resources for defense.
meanings.sent3: The school play was hilariously militarized with students dressed as soldiers and tanks made of cardboard.
meanings.sent4: Her focused attitude militarizes her approach to studying for exams.
meanings.sent5: The alarm militarizes the quiet night, signaling danger ahead.

meanings.sent1: The new uniform militarizes the look of the police force.
meanings.sent2: The strict rules militarize the atmosphere of the boot camp.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful behavior militarizes the living room, turning it into a battleground of toys.
meanings.sent4: His serious demeanor militarizes the tone of the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The old castle walls militarize the landscape, reminding all of its history of defense.
